intro: Dyssodia porophylla, commonly known as the porophylla daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are clustered in a single head. Dyssodia porophylla is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
